benchmark_details.name: GeoText-1652
benchmark_details.overview: GeoText-1652 is a new natural language-guided geolocalization benchmark that provides fine-grained spatial-aware text annotations for an existing image dataset, aimed at facilitating drone navigation and target localization tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance natural language-guided drone geolocalization and address the challenges of dataset availability and the alignment of language with fine-grained visual representations.

data.source: Built upon the University-1652 image dataset, with spatial-aware text annotations created through a human-computer interaction annotation process.
data.annotation: Generated through an interactive human-computer process leveraging Large Language Model-driven annotation techniques.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on similarity scores between image and text representations using cosine similarity.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Recall@K indicates a better performance in retrieving relevant images or text descriptions related to the input queries.
methodology.baseline_results: Achieved 31.2% Recall@10 accuracy surpassing established models such as ALBEF and XVLM.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using human feedback and comparison against baseline models.
